job_title: Anonymous Employee in Van Nuys, CA
pros: This place has undergone major changes and provides the community with resources it otherwise may not find. Great ER transformation and the 6 west rehab and wound care center does amazing!
cons: Sure, it's a small hospital and it has a family feel, but just like in a family, the department heads (administration included) choose favorites. Ive seen underqualified directors get a shield of protection (politics) while competent champions for change get dismissed or leave for better opportunities.

job_title: RN, Bsn in Van Nuys, CA
pros: It was so easy to get in.
cons: This facility has a very high turnover for nurses. They do not provide support to new grad nurses and they expect you to be flawless with your performance as a new grad nurse. Preceptors are way too subjective and critical and do not give you enough training to better your performance. HR are way too one sided. No progressive discipline and  outright termination if you make a minor mistake. Workload is too much for a new grad and too much time for charting is consumed because of their obsolete software.

job_title: RN in Van Nuys, CA
pros: The pay the least amount in the valley.
cons: The pay is not competitive , and constantly work short as a RN. The patients are very difficult lots of deadbeats in the ER , drunks druggies . The nurse week gift must have cost them all of 25 cents, I'm sure somebody from PR completed the other reviews. Only reason to work there is if you cannot get a job someplace else ..

job_title: Registered Nurse in Van Nuys, CA
pros: Vizient New Grad program, high turnover means they're always hiring. Excellent learning experience-baptism by fire. You will leave ready to take on any nursing job. Despite resources being an issue they're very aggressive about improving outcomes. Pay is decently competitive for being non union.
cons: High turnover, high stress, they expect a lot from nurses, but have limited support, and resources compared to bigger hospitals. Management seems to only maintain the status quo and keep costs down. Again, improvements to help nurses are a budget issue

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Van Nuys, CA
pros: Benefits at Valley Presbyterian Hospital are good. For employee only, medical coverage is free.
cons: Working at Valley Presbyterian for about 10 years now. There are almost no opportunities to grow within the company. If you are looking for a company and expect to move up in a matter of about 1-2 years, then VPH is not the place to work. Salary is not great either, since it is very close to minimum wage for clerical positions.
